IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ADDRESS THE PROBLEM OF HUNGER IN NEW YORK STATE BY IDENTIFYING AND ASSISTING THOSE IN NEED OF FEEDING, NUTRITION, AND ANTI-HUNGER PROGRAMS, AND ADVOCATING PUBLIC POLICIES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO ENDING HUNGER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE STRIVE TO MAXIMIZE PARTICIPATION IN, AND SUPPORT FOR, FEDERALLY FUNDED NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS INCLUDING SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP), THE SCHOOL BREAKFAST PROGRAM AND NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM, THE SUMMER FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM, THE SPECIAL SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION PROGRAM FOR WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN (WIC), AND THE CHILD AND ADULT CARE FOOD PROGRAM.
IRS990.Desc: NUTRITION OUTREACH/EDUCATION AND PUBLIC POLICY - PURPOSE IS TO ADDRESS THE PROBLEM OF HUNGER IN NEW YORK STATE BY IDENTIFYING AND ASSISTING THOSE IN NEED OF FEEDING, NUTRITION, AND ANTI-HUNGER PROGRAMS, AND ADVOCATING PUBLIC POLICIES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO ENDING HUNGER. TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES OBTAIN AVAILABLE BENEFITS, HUNGER SOLUTIONS NEW YORK, INC. ADMINISTERS 54 CONTRACTS WITH NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE, NUTRITION OUTREACH, AND EDUCATION SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HUNGER SOLUTIONS NEW YORK, INC. (HSNY) IS A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS NOT SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON INCOME RECEIVED FOR EXEMPT PURPOSES. NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN MADE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. HSNY FOLLOWS STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR INCOME TAX ACCOUNTING AND AVOIDS RISKS WITH TAX POSITIONS THAT MAY BE CHALLENGED UPON EXAMINATION. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES LIABILITY FROM TAXING AUTHORITY EXAMINATION, IF ANY, WOULD NOT HAVE A MATERIAL ADVERSE EFFECT ON HSNY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE ARE NO TAXING AUTHORITY EXAMINATIONS IN PROGRESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COST REIMBURSEMENT GRANTS ARE USED BY RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS TO CONDUCT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE POPULACE WITHIN THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION'S SERVICE AREA. OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS ARE FOR THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, REDUCED COST AND FREE SCHOOL MEALS, SUMMER FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM, AND OTHER NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. THESE EFFORTS ARE CONDUCTED THROUGH USE OF ADVERTISEMENTS IN LOCAL MEDIA, DISTRIBUTION OF POSTERS, BROCHURES, FLYERS, AND OTHER LOW COST PROMOTIONAL ITEMS, AND PRESENTATIONS TO POTENTIALLY ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS, INDIVIDUAL FACE TO FACE MEETINGS WITH POTENTIALLY ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS, AND OTHER OUTREACH AND EDUCATION METHODS APPROVED FOR USE ON THE NUTRITION OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAM. AN ON-SITE FISCAL REVIEW IS PERFORMED AT EACH RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS ONCE PER CONTRACT CYCLE (CURRENTLY 4 YEARS) TO TEST THE DOCUMENTATION FOR CHARGED EXPENSES. ALL SUBMITTED VOUCHERS ARE GIVEN A DESK AUDIT BY A FINANCE ASSOCIATE. A FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF THE VOUCHERS IS PERFORMED BY THE ASSOCIATE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. AN ON-SITE PROGRAM REVIEW IS PERFORMED TWICE PER CONTRACT CYCLE FOR NEW SUBCONTRACTORS AND ONCE PER CONTRACT CYCLE FOR EXPERIENCED SUBCONTRACTORS TO ASSESS PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND COMPLIANCE WITH PROGRAM GUIDELINES. ADDITIONALLY, SUBCONTRACTORS SUBMIT VARIOUS PROGRAM DOCUMENTATION AT LEAST QUARTERLY WHICH IS REVIEWED BY CONTRACT MANAGERS.

THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ON A LIMITED BASIS, BETWEEN BOARD MEETINGS. ALL BUSINESS CONDUCTED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE BETWEEN REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS SHALL BE SUBJECT TO RATIFICATION BY THE BOARD AT ITS NEXT REGULAR MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AS PART OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT, OUR INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM PREPARES A DRAFT OF THE 990 AND RELATED SUPPORTING SCHEDULES FROM OUR INTERNAL RECORDS. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND CONTROLLER REVIEW THE DRAFT FORM 990. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REQUIRED, ADDITIONS, CORRECTIONS, AND/OR QUESTIONS ARE FORWARDED TO THE PREPARER. AFTER FORM 990 IS FINALIZED, IT IS REVIEWED AGAIN BY THE CONTROLLER TO CONFIRM THAT ALL CHANGES HAVE BEEN INCLUDED, THE FINALIZED FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE 9BOARD TREASURER) FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. FORM 990 IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND A COPY IS SHARED WITH THE ENTIRE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HUNGER SOLUTIONS NEW YORK, INC. (HSNY) HAS A POLICY REQUIRING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE AND SUBMIT A "CONFLICT OF INTEREST" STATEMENT TO MANAGEMENT DECLARING POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. DECLARED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, IF ANY, ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND DISCUSSED WITH THE BOARD MEMBERS TO COME TO A DETERMINATION ON HOW TO PROCEED. BOARD MEMBERS WITH CONFLICTS OF INTEREST MUST BE RECUSED FROM VOTES PERTAINING TO TOPICS INVOLVING THE AREA OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IT IS ALSO POLICY THAT EMPLOYEES MUST PROMPTLY DISCLOSE ANY ACTUAL OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, IN WRITING, TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DETERMINES WHETHER THE DISCLOSED RELATIONSHIP MAY INTERFERE WITH THE EMPLOYEES DUTIES OR DAMAGE HSNY'S INTERESTS OR REPUTATION. A VIOLATION OF THIS POLICY WILL RESULT IN IMMEDIATE AND APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINE, IP TO AND INCLUDING TERMINATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO OFFICER OR OTHER MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVES COMPENSATION. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PERIODICALLY REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE AND COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. BASED ON THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE'S PRESENTATION TO THE BOARD OF DORECTORS, THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD SUBSEQUESNTLY DISCUSS, POTENTIALLY ALTER, AND VOTE ON THE COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS THE ONLY EMPLOYEE MEETING THE DEFINITION OF A TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR CONDUCTS OR REVIEWS AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES AND DETERMINES AND APPROVES THE EMPLOYEE'S ANNUAL COMPENSATION BASED ON PERFORMANCE AND AVAILABLE FUNDS CONSISTENT WITH THE BOARD APPROVED BUDGET

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON RECEIVING A REQUEST FOR DOCUMENTS DEEMED TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, SUCH AS FORM 990 OR AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, A REASONABLE FEE FOR COPYING WILL BE QUOTED. AFTER THIS FEE IS RECEIVED, THE REQUESTED DOCUMENTS ARE COPIED AND RELEASED.
RETURN IS BEING AMENDED TO SHOW ADDITIONAL GRANT ASSITANCE RECEIVED AT PART VIII LINE 1H.

RETURN IS BEING AMENDED TO SHOW ADDITIONAL GRANT ASSITANCE PAID AT PART IX LINE 1. ACCOUNTING, OTHER FEES FOR SERVICES, OFFICE EXPENSES AND INTEREST WERE ADJUSTED TO MATCH THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENT BALANCES FOR 6/30/22.
FORM 990 PART X IS BEING AMENDED TO THEIR AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENT BALANCE FOR 6/30/22.
SCHEDULE I IS BEING AMENDED TO ADD TWO ADDITIONAL GRANTEES AND ADJUST TWO SUBCONTRACTORS TOTAL GRANT AMOUNTS.
